pullRequest.title: JSTL Refactoring & Pull in JSTL 2.0 Impl
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #11643
Overview of the changes

Pulled out JSTL Impl (1.2) out of com.ibm.ws.jsp  and placed it into the new com.ibm.ws.org.apache.taglibs.standard

  @${repo;com.ibm.ws.javax.j2ee:jsp.tld.standard;1.2}, \
   @${repo;com.ibm.ws.org.apache:xalan;2.7.2}!/!META-INF/*, \


Pulled in the latest EE4J JSTL implementation ( org.glassfish.web:jakarta.servlet.jsp.jstl:2.0.0 ) and created io.openliberty.org.apache.taglibs.standard

The two taglib components above are now fragments. Their bnd files have the following added: Fragment-Host: com.ibm.ws.jsp(.jakarta)


Updated JSTL facade bundle to import versions 1.2 and the transformer changes them to 2.0 for the Pages 3.0 feature.

This change was done so that the versions would all align with the new JSTL bundles


Created io.openliberty.jstl.facade (which is basically the jakarta version of com.ibm.ws.jsp.jstl.facade)

nodes.bodyText: These highlighted packages are not included in the new Jakarta JSTL 2.0 jar, so they have been marked optional.
2.2,3.0 versions above ( for JSP) were changed to support the JSTL versions (1,2 and 2.0)
Since the Dynamic-ImportPackage code was removed, these transformations  should be updated.

nodes.bodyText: Will need to be adjusted if the prefix is changed. See eclipse-ee4j/jstl-api#138
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.org.apache.taglibs.standard
+Bundle-Description: Jakarta Standard Tag Library Implementation, version 2.0
+
+Fragment-Host: com.ibm.ws.jsp.jakarta
+
+Import-Package: \
+   com.oracle.wls.shaded.org.apache.xml.serialize;resolution:=optional,\
+   com.oracle.wls.shaded.org.apache.xml.serializer;resolution:=optional,\
+   !org.apache.xerces*, \
+   *
+
+Export-Package: \
+   org.apache.taglibs.standard.tlv;thread-context=true;version=2.0, \
+   org.apache.taglibs.standard.tei;thread-context=true;version=2.0, \
+   org.apache.taglibs*;version=2.0,\
+
+Private-Package: \
+  com.oracle.wls.shaded*,\

nodes.bodyText: These three are a bit odd since they’re in JSTL 1.2, but not in the JSTL 2.0 Impl.  I wasn’t sure where to update the versions here (facade bundle has them marked optional), but decided to add them just in case.

nodes.bodyText:
Discussed with Tom Watson and he said this bundle needs to provide this capability for this part: 
  
    
      open-liberty/dev/com.ibm.ws.jsp/src/com/ibm/ws/jsp/webcontainerext/JSPExtensionFactory.java
    
    
         Line 507
      in
      43eeef1
    
    
    
    

        
          
           return "com.ibm.ws.jsp.jstl.facade"; 
        
    
  


This capability is also provided by the com.ibm.ws.jsp.jstl.facade bundle.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.jstl.facade
+Bundle-Description: facade to provide a classloader for our internal jstl classes for osgi application jsp backwards compatibility; version=${bVersion}
+
+# Must provide same capability as the com.ibm.ws.jsp.jstl.facade bundle
+Provide-Capability: com.ibm.ws.jsp.jstl.facade

commit.message:
Pull JSTL 1.2 out of com.ibm.ws.jsp and into a new component

Create Jakarta JSTL 2.0 Implementation component
Create io.openliberty.jstl.facade as part of JSTL refactoring
